text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

ARVIND KARUNAKARAN: Advances
in AI and data analytics

give us the opportunity
to reimagine everything,

from operational logistics
to day-to-day tasks.

But how can you as
a leader empower

your team to embed
this technology
into their everyday work?

I'm Arvind Karunakaran,
an assistant professor

at the Stanford
School of Engineering.

In this course, I will
share important insights

from my own research, as well as
others' research about the most

successful strategies
for driving

the adoption of emerging
technologies such as AI
in the workplace.

You will learn
important techniques

for motivating your
employees to experiment
and innovate with AI and data.

And discover frameworks
that will help you
scale that innovative mindset.

We will explore case
studies across a wide range

of organizations, from
the retail giant Target,

to the basketball champion
team, Golden State Warriors.

And you'll hear from
industry professionals

around the world,
who are reinventing

the way their companies
operate, using technologies
such as AI and data analytics.

ANDRES SIGCHA: Our goal was
not just showing the data
but providing the insight.

Let us help you go
from A to B to C.

LAURE BELLUZZO: To
us, to be able to make

the link between
the business side
and the technological side.

MATTHEW CORRITORE: We're really
coaching all our analysts

and trying to lead
them to think about how

is your job potentially
going to change.

Instead of trying to
view that as a threat,

try to think about what
is the opportunity that

provides you to make
that work more impactful?

ARVIND KARUNAKARAN: So
ready to get started?

Let's reimagine the future of
your work with Stanford Online.
[AUDIO LOGO]
